result.execSummary:
The defendant Virginia Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine and costs.  Balance of fine and costs to be paid within 90 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Virginia Rodriguez

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:57 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Virginia Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Virginia Rodriguez. Brenda Bartholomew appeared in person as interpreter and sworn in.  

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read into Count 1.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defendant presents a statement.


Court orders the following:
	
Costs/Fine:  $515.00
DR GOD Surcharge: $10.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  To be paid in 90 days. Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

HOW TO PAY:
Payments can be made on-line with a MasterCard or electronic check at:  http://wcca.wicourts.gov  (Read the agreement, then click "I agree," then click "Pay fees on-line.")  OR you may contact the Waukesha County Clerk of Courts Business Center at 262-548-7497.
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with any Kohl's Store/Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to discuss this case with Juan Martinez-Ramirez listed in the Criminal Complaint.

08:49 AM Defendant Virginia Rodriguez in court with attorney Brandon K. Carlson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter.  Attorney Carlson appears as friend of the court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
